messages.title: Why I am Standing... A strong local voice.
messages.content:
UKIP will fight tirelessly for a better NHS. Labour has consistently misinformed the electorate with lies about UKIP privatising the NHS. It's the other parties, not UKIP, that want to end the NHS as free at point of contact.
UKIP will make sure the funding shortfall that is pushing the NHS to breaking point will be met. UKIP will integrate health and social care and build more core hospitals and mental health services.
UKIP will fight to make sure there is a fairer distribution of school funding for ordinary families. UKIP will put more into education to improve academic qualifications.
UKIP will lobby to remove VAT from domestic energy bills.
UKIP will install further controls of zero hour contracts and clampdowns on corporate tax avoidance, with cuts in immigration to end the downward spiral of labour for unskilled and semi-skilled roles.
UKIP will encourage better access to decent secure housing for those struggling to find safe housing and provide more local homes for local people, prioritising our war veterans.
UKIP will stop hospital car parking charges, which has become a tax on the sick and a financial burden on low paid health workers.
UKIP will not be dictated by 'politically correctness'. Elected representatives will always stand up for local people and put common sense before political correctness.
UKIP are the only party totally committed to giving YOU, the people, control over your own country.
I was born and bred here, I live and breathe Stoke-on-Trent and if elected, I will represent all sections of the community, to bring about a better, fairer and safer life for all.

messages.title: About Me
messages.content:
I was born in Stoke-on-Trent and have lived here all my life.
I have worked hard earning a living, so I can relate to the problems facing ordinary people today. By running my own business, I can also bring a practical business focus to supporting local enterprises here in Stoke.
If elected, I will put the people of this City first above any party politics, striving to raise the profile of Stoke-on-Trent and working tirelessly to bring much needed investment to the City which will bring more local employment helping create better paid jobs.
I actively campaigned for the UK to leave the EU, because I believe the UK is better off out, as do the majority of people in this City.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP will fight tirelessly for a better NHS. Labour has consistently misinformed the electorate with lies about UKIP privatising the NHS. UKIP will make sure the funding shortfall is met and will integrate health and social care to build more core hospitals and mental health services.
UKIP will fight to make sure there is a fairer distribution of school funding for ordinary families and will put more into education to improve academic qualifications.
UKIP will lobby to remove VAT from domestic energy bills.

UKIP will install further controls of zero hour contracts and clampdowns on corporate tax avoidance, with cuts in immigration to end the downward spiral of labour for unskilled and semi-skilled roles.
UKIP will encourage better access to decent secure housing for those struggling to find safe housing and provide more local homes for local people, prioritising war veterans.
UKIP will stop hospital car parking charges, which has become a tax on the sick and a financial burden on low paid health workers.
UKIP will not be dictated by 'politically correctness'. Elected representatives will always stand up for local people and put common sense before political correctness.
